label: 官稲
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: The tax of rice on paddy fields (so) that the government collected. It was then divided into three parts; the government stored rice used to meet general expenses (shōzei or ōchikara ), unhulled rice that was stored away in the granaries for famine years (gisō ), and rice stored away for extraordinary expenses. From Kammu-Tennō's reign (781-806) on the government rice (kantō) was divided into shōzei, loaned government rice (kugetō ), and rice to be used to meet miscellaneous and extraordinary expenses. [租、正税、大税、義倉、桓武天皇、公廨稲 [also read kugaitō]]
